QuantPlierBase Class Reference

Base class for doing probe set quantification using either the PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method or the ITER-PLIER method, which iteratively calls PLIER with the probes that best correlate with signal estimate. More...

#include <QuantPlierBase.h>

Detailed Description

Base class for doing probe set quantification using either the PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method or the ITER-PLIER method, which iteratively calls PLIER with the probes that best correlate with signal estimate.

virtual void QuantPlierBase::setFeaturePriorEffects ( double *  featureEffects,
int  iSize 
) [pure virtual]

Specify precomputed feature effects to be used as map from probe id index to the feature effect.

This make plier much faster to do as doesn't have to iterate through anything, but have to make sure that the feature effects being used match the analysis that is being done. For example the feature effects might be different using pm-only, pm-gcbg and pm-mm adjustments.

Note: this is only used by plier, not by iter-plier.

Parameters:
featureEffects - mapping from probe idex to feature effects.

Implemented in QuantPlier.

Referenced by setParameters().

const IntensityMart &  iMart,
std::vector< ChipStream * > &  iTrans,
PmAdjuster &  pmAdjust 
) [virtual]

Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe set, chip layout and data.

Parameters:
psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
layout - Chip layout annotation.
iMart - Raw data from chips.
iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
Returns:
bool - True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.

Expected feature effect is 1.0 +/- some minor adjustment.

Implements QuantMethod.

void QuantPlierBase::setUsePrecompFeatureEffects ( bool  value  )  [protected]

Use this to toggle whether or not QuantPlier should be using precomputed feature effects (aka feature response, sometimes know incorrectly as 'affinity').

Much faster to do as plier doesn't have to iterate through anything, but have to make sure that the feature effects being used match the analysis that is being done. For example the feature effects might be different using pm-only, pm-gcbg and pm-mm adjustments.

Parameters:
value - true if using precomputed feature effects false otherwise.
